result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony N. Lomonte

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 8:52am
INCLUDES 15CF709 & 15CM1355
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer.  Deft appears with Atty Anne Renc.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15CM1355:
Ct. 1 Disorderly Conduct >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA:
15CF709:
Ct. 1 Sex Registry Violation- repeater >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 3 years probation. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Comply with sex offender registry requirments. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours of community service per week. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge, however if sample has already been provided deft does not need to duplicate. 83 days credit granted if revoked.  

Adj: 9:04am

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF709 and 15CM1355 Called: 9:19am
State appears by ADA L.Gramer; Deft appears in person/in custody with Atty Anne Renc
Waiver of Prelim. filed in 15CF709.
  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea:  NOT GUILTY
Dates already set for PTC - however parties request matter be set for plea
Bond:  Continued

Pre-trial conference at 01-15-2016 10:10 am.
Review hearing at 01-25-2016 09:15 am.

INCLUDES 15CF709 & 15CM1355 Comply with Sex Offender registry.   No contact with E.C.
